translation.message: A set of tools to build and manage the Hugo documentation translation environment
hugo-docs-i18n is a set of tools to initialize and manage the environment to translate Hugo Documentation in you language.
Initialization of the configuration file for the Hugo Document Translation Environment
Generate a configuration file for localization of Hugo Documentation.

Output the number of translated/not-translated files,
 and what percentage of the files have been translated.

The data is stored "data/i18n/<code>.json", and show the page.
Create Locale Database from ISO 639-1 standard language codes

hugo-docs-i18n init command need locale code for translated language.
This command create locale database from the Markdown file of the follows:

ISO 639-1 standard language codes:
https://www.andiamo.co.uk/resources/iso-language-codes/

The above file is saved as "data/ISO_639-1.md",
and will be converted to JSON file as "data/ISO_639-1.json".
Search locale code for target translation language

If you do not know your language locale code, you can search it with this command
or the following web page:

ISO 639-1 standard language codes:
https://www.andiamo.co.uk/resources/iso-language-codes/
Copy and update content files from English to target language

Copy and update content files written in English to "content/<code>" directory.
Before execute this command, you should execute "hugo-docs-i18n init".
Print the version number of hugo-docs-i18n

Print the version number of hugo-docs-i18n. 
Also, this information is used for developers.
